headline: C3 AI Announces Fiscal Third Quarter 2026 Results
summary: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., February 25, 2026--C3.ai, Inc. ("C3 AI," "C3," or the "Company") (NYSE: AI), the Enterprise AI application software company, today announced financial results for its fiscal third quarter ended January 31, 2026.

headline: AVLV Is Up 24.5% While Filtering Out the Value Traps Other ETFs Miss
summary: Most value ETFs simply screen for cheap stocks. The Avantis U.S. Large Cap Value ETF takes a different approach: it filters for stocks that are both cheap and profitable, a distinction that historically separates durable value from value traps. That dual screen is the core thesis behind AVLV, and whether it justifies owning it over ... AVLV Is Up 24.5% While Filtering Out the Value Traps Other ETFs Miss

headline: Federal judge in Texas allows lawsuit against California attorney general over ExxonMobil remarks
summary: A federal judge in Texas has ruled that ExxonMobil can bring a defamation lawsuit against California’s attorney general over comments about the company’s plastic recycling efforts.  U.S. District Judge Michael J. Truncale in the Eastern District of Texas said in a ruling earlier this month that California Attorney General Rob Bonta cannot claim official immunity in regards to several statements he made, including one in a campaign email sent to Texas residents.

headline: Eni Advances Angola Portfolio With Ndungu Field's First Oil Production
summary: E kicks off Ndungu oil production offshore Angola, targeting 60,000 bpd as the Agogo hub ramps up toward a 175,000 bpd combined output.

headline: Oil Prices Rise. Why More Gains Could Come Thursday.
summary: Oil prices were rising early Wednesday, trading at near seven-month highs as investors continue to monitor tensions between the U.S. and Iran.  Brent crude futures  were up by 0.2% to $70.7 per barrel.  Elsewhere,  West Texas Intermediate  futures were trading at $65.66, up 0.1% from Tuesday’s close.

headline: Is Exxon Mobil (XOM) Still Attractive After A 40% One Year Share Price Gain
summary: If you are wondering whether Exxon Mobil's current share price really reflects its long term value, you are not alone. This article is designed to help you frame that question clearly. The stock last closed at US$149.26, with returns of 2.1% over 7 days, 10.6% over 30 days, 21.7% year to date, 40.7% over 1 year and 50.4% over 3 years, while the 5 year return is very large at 222.4%. Recent news flow around Exxon Mobil has focused on its position among major integrated energy companies and...
